td.h2: Cursor introduces Progressive Web App support, turning its coding agent into a native-like experience on mobile

td.p: 12,639 Likes
Cursor Agents now work beyond the IDE. Whether youâ€™re fixing bugs, exploring a codebase, or building features, you can launch and monitor tasks directly from any browser or mobile device.

p.strong: How does it work at a high level?

td.p: Agents can be accessed from any desktop or mobile browser or installed as a Progressive Web App (PWA) for a native-like experience. They integrate with repositories, allow follow-up instructions, and can be triggered or updated via Slack.

li.p: Launch code tasks like bug fixes, features, and Q&A remotely
Access on desktop, tablet, or mobile browser
Install as a Progressive Web App (PWA) on iOS/Android
Review agent diffs and pull requests via web UI
Collaborate via Slack: trigger agents with @Cursor, get notified when tasks finish
Run parallel agents and compare outputs
Share images and context to guide agents

td.p: Start at cursor.com/agents. Install the app as a PWA from your browser. Connect your repo to view and review diffs, PRs, and agent output. Set up Slack integration to use agents in team conversations.
Mobile agents donâ€™t offer the full IDE editing experience. May find error when setting up for GitHub repo access. Some advanced features work best when returning to the Cursor IDE.

p.i: PWA is not quite a native app experience.
also just launches a web browser in the PWA so nothing appears to persist.

td.h2: You can now turn any workflow into a video guide instantly

td.p: Repeating the same task over and over wastes time and drains focus.

strong.span: Guiddeâ€™s AI-powered extension turns any workflow into a step-by-step video guide automatically.

li.p: Create stunning visual guides 11x faster than manual documentation
Capture complex tasks in seconds with AI voiceover and visuals
Share or embed anywhere, no editing required

p.strong: Itâ€™s built for fast, effective knowledge sharing, with:

li.p: A 100% free Chrome extension, no signup walls
One-click capture from your browser
Instant guides with call-to-action, visuals, and narration built in

Build an AI system that researches online, plans article structure, and writes Wikipedia-style text with sources. It handles retrieval, summarization, citation, and structured writing end-to-end.
4,294 Stars

This repo contains the VSâ€¯Code Copilot Chat extension. You ask questions, get code suggestions, explanations, unit tests, multiâ€‘file edits, and agent workflows. It supports Ask, Edit, and Agent modes.

td.p: â‡§ 2,628 Likes

This lecture explains how ChatGPT evolved from launch debates to viral adoption. Nick Turley, Head of ChatGPT and Mark Chen, OpenAIâ€™s Chief Research Officer, break down reasoning in AI, and discuss tradeoffs in model behavior.

li.p: naming origins
sycophancy and RLHF
personalization with memory
breakthroughs in ImageGen

td.p: They also share ChatGPT coding practices, internal adoption stories, and practical tips for adapting your own workflows as AI tools advance.

td.p: At Alpha Signal, our mission is to build a sharp, engaged community focused on AI, machine learning, and cutting-edge language models, helping over 200,000 developers stay informed and ahead. Weâ€™re passionate about curating the best in AI, from top research and trending technical blogs to expert insights and tailored job opportunities. We keep you connected to the breakthroughs and discussions that matter, so you can stay in the loop without endless searching. We also work closely with partners who value the future of AI, including employers and advertisers who want to reach an audience as passionate about AI as we are.

Our partnerships are based on shared values of ethics, responsibility, and a commitment to building a better world through technology.Privacy is a priority at Alpha Signal.
